channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15438] error: CF specified in importtsv.columns does not match with table CF
item.description:
Try to play with the hbase tsv import, get such error:

ERROR: Column Families [ Current, Closing] specified in importtsv.columns does not match with any of the table StocksB column families [Closing, Current].

the script is:

hbase org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.ImportTsv -Dimporttsv.columns="HBASE_ROW_KEY, Current:Price, Closing:Price" -Dimporttsv.bulk.output="/user/bob/storeDataFileOutput/" StocksB /user/bob/stocks.txt

If i remove the space which behind the comma and before CF name, everything is fine.
As a Dev, I like to add some space over there for easy reading and checking.
Please trim these CF names before processing, thanks!

https://github.com/apache/hbase/blob/master/hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/mapreduce/ImportTsv.java
item.summary: error: CF specified in importtsv.columns does not match with table CF

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.

comments.comment:
Hi Mikhail,
Here is a quick fix for the trim for column family names
Thanks
Sreenath

This message was automatically generated.
I will update the tests and add a new patch

Steps to verify

1. Create a table in hbase as "Create tabel 'StockB', 'Current', 'Closing'"
2. Create a txt file with content "RK2 15.00 16.00"
3. Run command as
hbase org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.ImportTsv -Dimporttsv.columns="HBASE_ROW_KEY, Current:Price, Closing:Price" -Dimporttsv.bulk.output="

{outputFileName}

" StocksB

{textFileName}

4. Note the space between ROW_KEY, and Current as well as Current:Price, and Closing:Price. This is the cause of the problem.
